title: Interdisciplinary Management of the Patient with Cleidocranial Dysplasia: A Ten-Year Treatment
content: Cleidocranial dysplasia (CCD) â€“ is an autosomal dominant skeletal dysplasia with a prevalence of 1  in 1 million individuals. This rare disorder is associated with clavicular hypoplasia or aplasia, delayed closure of fontanels, brachycephalic skull, delayed exfoliation of primary teeth , delayed eruption of permanent and, multiple supernumerary teeth, and morphologic abnormalities of maxilla and mandible. The purpose of this paper is to describe the multidisciplinary surgical, pediatric stomatologic and orthodontic treatment of CCD. A case of a young boy suffering from CCD along with the long-term management, is described in the present report. The patient was 8 years and  5 months old when first presented in the clinic and has been treated for another ten years by the interdisciplinary team comprised of the pediatric dentist, the orthodontist, and the maxillofacial surgeon. The report encompasses  a detailed description of the clinical and radiographic findings as clinical, surgical, and orthodontic interventions. The treatment of such cases requires long-term management, close cooperation of specialists, and proper dental age assessment.
